text: "Midnight to Six Man" is a song by British garage rock band the Pretty Things. It was first published in 1966 and registered at number 46 in the UK Singles Chart and 19 in the Netherlands. The arrangement is one of the fullest on early Pretty Things cuts, due to the piano of Nicky Hopkins (who played similar R&B; piano on the Who's My Generation album) and the organist from the all-female band Goldie and the Gingerbreads. == Personnel == *Phil May – vocals *Dick Taylor – lead guitar *Brian Pendleton – guitar *John Stax – bass guitar *Skip Alan – drums == Chart performance == {| class="wikitable" |- ! Chart (1966) !
